page.title: 12 Sheriff's Ride
page.content: On the Saturday nearest 8th September, the Sheriff and his officials, along with about 200 other riders, set off on a 16 mile trek. This is to take them around the ancient boundary of Lichfield. This ceremony was started in the year 1664, when a charter was issued to let Lichfield elect a Mayor and a Sheriff. The charter then went on to say that the Sheriff should, on the 8th September, ride round the boundary. They were to stop at certain stations, where they were given specific drinks which included ginger wine in milk, port, sherry and a few others. Unfortunately for the riders they are only given sherry.
